Question: Many stars can be seen in the sky at night. Which statement best explains why the Sun appears brighter than the stars seen in the night sky?

Choices:
A: The Sun is bigger than the stars seen in the night sky.
B: The Sun is smaller than the stars seen in the night sky.
C: The Sun is closer to Earth than the stars seen in the night sky.
D: The Sun is farther from Earth than the stars seen in the night sky.
steps: The brightness of an object in the sky is affected by its distance from the observer. The closer an object is, the brighter it appears.
The Sun is the closest star to Earth, situated at approximately 93 million miles away, while other stars are much farther away.
Even if the Sun and other stars had the same intrinsic brightness, the Sun would appear much brighter because of its proximity to Earth.
Among the provided options, the statement that best explains why the Sun appears brighter than the stars is that it is closer to Earth than the stars.
